AttackModel.Objective: Execute arbitrary code on the web server and retrieve the flag.

Phases.Description: Initial reconnaissance of the target website.

Actions.Result: Identify that the website is an online calculator.

Phases.Description: Exploit the website's vulnerability to execute arbitrary code.

Actions.Action: Submit a POST request with a simple arithmetic expression (1+1) as the statement parameter
Actions.Result: Observe that the website uses PHP eval() function and returns the result (2).

Actions.Action: Submit a POST request with a payload containing double curly braces ({{}}) as the statement parameter
Actions.Result: Trigger a syntax error in the PHP eval() function, confirming the use of eval().

Actions.Action: Submit a POST request with a payload containing 'system('id')' as the statement parameter
Actions.Result: Execute the 'id' command on the server and obtain the result, revealing the user as 'www-data'.

Phases.Description: Exploit the ability to execute system commands to gather information.

Actions.Action: Submit a POST request with a payload containing 'system('ls -al')' as the statement parameter
Actions.Result: List the directory contents on the server, revealing the 'index.php' file.

Actions.Action: Submit a POST request with a payload containing 'system('cat index.php')' as the statement parameter
Actions.Result: Retrieve the content of the 'index.php' file, which contains the flag 'auctf{p6p_1nj3c7i0n_iz_k3wl}'.
